arm_group.description: adding 3gm l-carnitine from day 1 to day 12 of induced the menstrual cycle by 50 mg clomiphene

brief_summary.textblock:
Adding L-carnitine is more successful than clomiphene as a first line therapy for ovulation
      induction in women with clomiphene resistant PCOS

clinical_study.brief_title: Adding L-carnitine in Clomiphene Resistant Polycystic Ovary Improves the Quality of Ovulation and the Pregnancy Outcome

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients younger than 35 years, presenting with primary or secondary infertility following
      regular intercourse for at least 1 year and diagnosed with PCO according to Rotterdam's
      criteria  who had received five unsuccessful clomiphene citrate-timed intercourse
      stimulation cycles were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients younger than 35 years, presenting with primary or secondary infertility
             following regular intercourse for at least 1 year and diagnosed with PCO according to
             Rotterdam's criteria  who had received five unsuccessful clomiphene citrate-timed
             intercourse stimulation cycles were included. The diagnosis was based on a complete
             history taking, physical examination and a paper documented complete infertility
             work-up within the previous 6 months, either conducted within the setting of the
             hospital or at a licensed infertility management clinic.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age more than 40 years,

          -  tubal,uterine or male factor infertility

intervention.description: 3gm l-carnitine from day 1 to day 12 of the menstrual cycle

clinical_study.official_title: Adding L-carnitine in Clomiphene Resistant Pco Improves the Quality of Ovulation and the Pregnancy Outcome,a Randomized Clinical Trial

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: is to study the efficacy of l-carnitine in inducing ovulation in clomiphene resistant pco

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: the occurrence of pregnancy and the rate of continuation of pregnancy till end of the first trimester

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
